 1938. James Lee Quatermain is a man of many talents, but saving money is not one of them. James is a professional adventurer, like his legendary grandfather Allan Quatermain. And he knows how to squeeze the fame of his name to make money, while he despises. Despises equally to those who believe in the stories of his great-grandfather on the natural and laughing at them. Consequently, Quatermain not feel like too to accompany Jennifer Goodwin, an American agent working his former partner, a Egyptian temple to retrieve an ancient artifact - the Heart of Atlantis. He did not believe in the reputed stimulating qualities of the artifact, or care in the least that a division of the Ahnenerbe, the Nazi Department specializes in the occult, also go behind the Heart. But life has its ways to make the perspective of someone changes. Quatermain suddenly thrust into a hunt to across the world - from the stormy deserts of Egypt to the icy depths of the Arctic, and all the way to the humid jungles of Guatemala. In so long forgotten temple structures, the thrill of the chase awakens Quatermain true adventurer in him, as he and Goodwin agent strive to be one step ahead of the Nazis and the Russians, one step closer to getting the Heart of Atlantis. And in the depths of these temples, where ancient guardians awaken from their eternal sleep, James soon learns that his great-grandfather's stories are not as crazy as he had always believed. All things live forever, but sometimes they sleep and are forgotten ...
